strapiSongs.title: As the Aged Wanderer Doth Sulk (Slave of the Seas)
strapiSongs.lyrics:
A storm approaches, the clouds are darkened, black castles reign the sky
The hour is nearing, all we were fearing, donâ€™t be afraid to die
Nothing familiar, is here for comfort, night and shade collide
Cold thorns are bleeding, me from the inside, how did I lose my life

Where have we gone now, so far away from, all that I ever tried
To hold together, our bond forever

Yeah
And I beg the heavens for solace
I cry and weep and pray, heal me

What have I done to deserve this fate
strapiSongs.credits: Music by Victor Fisher of Reenchantment.
strapiSongs.description: A highly romanticized funeral doom song. They should play this at the opera.

recordings.title: As the Aged Wanderer Doth Sulk (Slave of the Seas)
